I've seen, and lusted over, that particular tsuba before.  I don't collect kinko at all,  but this is one of a small number of cases which, granted a opportunity, would lead me to alter my policy.

David Zincavage

  -t,
  the Ko-kinko tsuba is in the Lundgren collection book and a scan is 
  available in my photo album on the list, Pete the dentist has a better 
  scan...........

  got another question ..........
  Is the Aizu Shoami school of soft metal tsuba the " Bungo sword " of 
  the tsuba world ?....like if one is not sure what it is then chances 
  are it's an Aizu  " Shoamimono " ??

  Milt
